alert.note: Alert for Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 7:37AM CDT until June 09 at 2:53AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma, east central Oklahoma, southeast Oklahoma and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, McClain. In east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc. In southeast Oklahoma, Coal. In southern Oklahoma, Garvin. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 737 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ada, Stratford, Byng, Stonewall, Tupelo, Fitzhugh, Fittstown and Vanoss. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
